intro: Stemodiopsis kamundii, commonly known as the Kashmir spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions. The plant features a short, thick stem with opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, often displaying yellow or greenish hues. The plant contains latex, which is a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family to which it belongs.
